column4: I cannot get my webcam to work. When I plug it in, nothing happens, I have tried many applications and none seem to work
It seems like the camera is not recognized by the system. The model is Intel CS630
not all webcams are supported in linux. Theres too many of them  out.
thats is just what the usb device is identifying itslef as.
that makes no sence...   McDonolds and other stores/places offer free wifi.
ive seen various 'web site scrapers' that can do that.. but never used any.
find a PPA for it. or recompile from source is one way to upgrade it
guess you go look for a PPA for it then.
This is not the first time this has happened. I am on the PPA page, and some dependency file is downloadable as a .deb, but the binary package itself is nowhere to be found
you mean a normal music cd right?
one normally dosent mount audio cds
you start a music player and let it play them - or rip them to mp3 or whatever
Surprising then, that the mount function is issued automagically when an audio CD is inserted. I will try opening with a media player.
a live cd will not be using the nvidia drivers. it will be using the opensources novau (or whateve rits called) drivers
I think you have myself and another's questions/comments combined.

My problem is solved. Autoplay functions properly within Nautilus as it issues a mount command and then a load media directory within Nautilus command. It does the same however with audio CD's which is strange, since it clearly detects the media type before issuing the erroneous commands.
